lwm2m-security-config.identity-tooltip:
The PSK identifier is an arbitrary PSK identifier up to 128 bytes, as described in the standard [RFC7925].
The PSK identifier MUST first be converted to a character string and then encoded into octets using UTF-8.
lwm2m-security-config.client-key-tooltip-prk: RPK public key or id must be in the standard [RFC7250] and encoded to Base64 format!
lwm2m-security-config.client-key-tooltip-psk: PSK key must be in the standard [RFC4279] and HexDec format: 32, 64, 128 characters!
lwm2m-security-config.client-public-key-hint: If client public key is empty, the trusted certificate will be used
lwm2m-security-config.client-public-key-tooltip: X509 public key must be in DER-encoded X509v3 format and support exclusively EC algorithm and then encoded to Base64 format!
lwm2m-security-config.client-publicKey-or-id-required: Client Public Key or Id is required.
lwm2m-security-config.client-publicKey-or-id-tooltip-psk:
The PSK identifier is an arbitrary PSK identifier up to 128 bytes, as described in the standard [RFC7925].
The PSK identifier MUST first be converted to a character string and then encoded into octets using UTF-8.
lwm2m-security-config.client-publicKey-or-id-tooltip-rpk: RPK public key or id must be in the standard [RFC7250] and encoded to Base64 format!
lwm2m-security-config.client-publicKey-or-id-tooltip-x509: X509 public key must be in DER-encoded X509v3 format and support exclusively EC algorithm and then encoded to Base64 format
lwm2m-security-config.client-secret-key-tooltip-psk: PSK key must be in the standard [RFC4279] and HexDec format: 32, 64, 128 characters!
lwm2m-security-config.client-secret-key-tooltip-prk: RPK secret key must be in PKCS_8 format (DER encoding, standard [RFC5958]) and then encoded to Base64 format!
lwm2m-security-config.client-secret-key-tooltip-x509: X509 secret key must be in PKCS_8 format (DER encoding, standard [RFC5958]) and then encoded to Base64 format!

device-profile.mqtt-device-topic-filters-unique: MQTT device topic filters need to be unique.
device-profile.mqtt-enable-compatibility-with-json-payl: Enable compatibility with other payload formats.

When enabled, the platform will use a Protobuf payload format by default. If parsing fails, the platform will attempt to use JSON payload format. Useful for backward compatibility during firmware updates. For example, the initial release of the firmware uses Json, while the new release uses Protobuf. During the process of firmware update for the fleet of devices, it is required to support both Protobuf and JSON simultaneously. The compatibility mode introduces slight performance degradation, so it is recommended to disable this mode once all devices are updated.
device-profile.mqtt-use-json-format-for-default-downlin: Use Json format for default downlink topics

When enabled, the platform will use Json payload format to push attributes and RPC via the following topics: v1/devices/me/attributes/response/$request_id, v1/devices/me/attributes, v1/devices/me/rpc/request/$request_id, v1/devices/me/rpc/response/$request_id. This setting does not impact attribute and rpc subscriptions sent using new (v2) topics: v2/a/res/$request_id, v2/a, v2/r/req/$request_id, v2/r/res/$request_id. Where $request_id is an integer request identifier.
device-profile.snmp-mapping-not-configured: No mapping for OID to timeseries/telemetry configured

device-profile.rpc-request-proto-schema-required: RPC request proto schema is required.
device-profile.rpc-request-proto-schema-hint: RPC request message should always have fields: string method = 1; int32 requestId = 2; and params = 3 of any data type.
device-profile.not-valid-single-character: Invalid use of a single-level wildcard character
device-profile.not-valid-multi-character: Invalid use of a multi-level wildcard character
device-profile.single-level-wildcards-hint: [+] is suitable for any topic filter level. Ex.: v1/devices/+/telemetry or +/devices/+/attributes.
device-profile.multi-level-wildcards-hint: [#] can replace the topic filter itself and must be the last symbol of the topic. Ex.: # or v1/devices/me/#.
device-profile.alarm-type-unique: Alarm type must be unique within the device profile alarm rules.

lwm2m.short-id-tooltip:
Server short Id. Used as link to associate server Object Instance.
This identifier uniquely identifies each LwM2M Server configured for the LwM2M Client.
Resource MUST be set when the Bootstrap-Server Resource has a value of 'false'.
The values ID:0 and ID:65535 values MUST NOT be used for identifying the LwM2M Server.
lwm2m.short-id-range: Short server ID should be in a range from 1 to 65534.
lwm2m.short-id-pattern: Short server ID must be a positive integer.
lwm2m.lifetime-pattern: Client registration lifetime must be a positive integer.
lwm2m.default-min-period-tooltip: The default value the LwM2M Client should use for the Minimum Period of an Observation in the absence of this parameter being included in an Observation.
lwm2m.default-min-period-pattern: Minimum period must be a positive integer.
lwm2m.notification-storing: Notification storing when disabled or offline

binding-type.u: U: Client is reachable via the UDP binding at any time.
binding-type.m: M: Client is reachable via the MQTT binding at any time.
binding-type.h: H: Client is reachable via the HTTP binding at any time.
binding-type.t: T: Client is reachable via the TCP binding at any time.
binding-type.s: S: Client is reachable via the SMS binding at any time.
binding-type.n: N: Client MUST send the response to such a request over the Non-IP binding (is supported since LWM2M 1.1).
binding-type.uq: UQ: UDP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.uqs: UQS: both UDP and SMS connections active; UDP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tq: TQ: TCP connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.tqs: TQS: both TCP and SMS connections active; TCP in queue mode, SMS in standard mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)
binding-type.sq: SQ: SMS connection in queue mode (is not supported since LWM2M 1.1)

lwm2m.binding-tooltip:
This is the list in the"binding" resource of the LwM2M server object - /1/x/7.
Indicates the supported binding modes in the LwM2M Client.
This value SHOULD be the same as the value in the “Supported Binding and Modes” resource in the Device Object (/3/0/16).
While multiple transports are supported, only one transport binding can be used during the entire Transport Session.
As an example, when UDP and SMS are both supported, the LwM2M Client and the LwM2M Server can choose to communicate either over UDP or SMS during the entire Transport Session.

lwm2m.bootstrap-update-text: Be careful, after the confirmation the Bootstrap Server configuration data will become unrecoverable.

lwm2m.account-after-timeout-required: Account after the timeout is required.
lwm2m.account-after-timeout-pattern: Account after the timeout must be a positive integer.

lwm2m.client-strategy-only-observe: Only Observe Request to the client after the initial connection
lwm2m.client-strategy-read-all: Read All Resources & Observe Request to the client after registration

lwm2m.fw-update-strategy-package: Push firmware update as binary file using Object 5 and Resource 0 (Package)

lwm2m.sw-update-strategy-package-uri: Auto-generate unique CoAP URL to download the package and push software update using Object 9 and Resource 3 (Package URI)

lwm2m.sw-update-resource-required: Software update CoAP resource is required.

entity-view.attributes-propagation-hint: Entity View will automatically copy specified attributes from Target Entity each time you save or update this entity view. For performance reasons target entity attributes are not propagated to entity view on each attribute change. You can enable automatic propagation by configuring "copy to view" rule node in your rule chain and linking "Post attributes" and "Attributes Updated" messages to the new rule node.
